explanation: Scale, ruler, thermometer, and clock are all instruments used to measure specific physical quantities (mass, length, temperature, and time, respectively). A magnet, while possessing physical properties, is not an instrument for measurement.

category: Major Ancient Structures Primarily Lost to History
explanation: The Library of Alexandria, Colossus of Rhodes, Hanging Gardens, and Lighthouse of Alexandria are all significant ancient structures or sites that have been largely destroyed or whose existence is debated, with few or no physical remains visible today. The Great Wall of China, while ancient, remains a largely intact and visible landmark.

Socks and gloves are typically worn in pairs. Scissors consist of two complementary blades, and trousers have two legs. All these items inherently involve a duality or come in pairs for their common function. A hat, however, is a singular item.
